title: Alexandria fire: Sydney factory blaze delays traffic, closes roads
text:
Fire has destroyed a factory unit on Beaconsfield Street, Alexandria. The Gastronomy Food Business was one that was well alight. Footage: Bill Hearne

Ten units have been extensively damaged by an intense and difficult inner-Sydney factory fire which has been burning for hours.

Traffic has been heavily disrupted and motorists are advised to avoid Botany Rd at Alexandria due to the large blaze this morning, which has prompted significant road closures.

Emergency services were called out at 2.15am to find a commercial unit well alight.

About thirty fire appliances and 100 firefighters are working to extinguish the fire which has spread to adjoining buildings, police said.

FRNSW Acting Superintendent Nick Andronicos said the businesses occupying the units range from automotive to kitchen-type and furniture with different fuel loads and posing various hazards.

At about 8.30am, he said three units still had “active fire in there”.

“We’ve managed to contain the fire to probably about 12 or so units, 10 have been damaged,” he said.

“At this point in time we’re not letting anyone in the building so the owners won’t be able to get into the building until later on today.”

He said the roof and a mezzanine level had collapsed due to the intensity of the fire, which was “difficult” to fight based on the complexity of the units.

Clothing company General Pants Co. lists its head office at unit 25 of 30-32 Beaconsfield St, which has been captured in photographs of the inferno.

Officers evacuated five people from a nearby unit block and no injures have been reported.

A FRNSW spokeswoman told news.com.au the fire was considered “expanding” at 3.44am in “24 individual units, packaging and plastic”.

An update given within the next two hours said it was contained within the building, she said.

The NSW Environment Protection Authority has been consulted and any hazardous materials run-off is being monitored.

Botany Rd is closed northbound between Morley Ave and Queen St and one of two southbound lanes on the major thoroughfare is also closed.

There are further closures in place at Beaconsfield Rd and William St, and Beaconsfield Rd and Botany Rd.

Live Traffic NSW said Route 348 buses are being diverted away from Collins St and four stops are being missed.

There are “heavy traffic conditions” and commuters are being affected in both directions.

Motorists are urged to consider using O’Riordan St to get through the area or another alternative route.

Anyone with information about the fire is urged to contact Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000.
